body.name: Western Digital Black WD5000LPSX 500 GB Hard Drive - 2.5" Internal - SATA (SATA/600)
body.merchantInfo: Ships from and sold by ebid-dealz.
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Wednesday, February 14. Order within 7 hrs 24 mins.
Or fastest delivery Wednesday, February 14. Order within 5 hrs 24 mins.
features: Specifically designed for small form factor desktops, laptops, and Mac computers
Performance 2.5-inch hard drives available in up to 1TB capacities
Designed for creative professionals, gamers, and system builders
body.description: Great Things Come in Small Packages - WD Black™ 2.5-inch PC Hard Drives are designed to enhance your PC experience, whether at home in your new all-in-one desktop, or on-the-go in your trusty notebook. With up to 1TB of storage running at 7200 RPM, you get an extremely fast high-capacity mobile hard drive, offering the perfect storage solution for a digital artist, video editor, photographer, or gamer. Backed by an industry leading 5-year limited warranty, WD Black 2.5-inch Hard Drives combine performance and capacity with the reliability of a brand you can trust..For Creative Professionals - Give yourself the room to bring your enormous digital portfolio wherever you're at with WD Black™ 2.5-inch PC Hard Drives. With up to 1TB of 7200 RPM-Class high-performance storage, WD Black 2.5-inch Hard Drives give you the power to create while on the go, so you can offload, edit, and shoot without fear of running out of space anytime soon.For Gamers - WD Black™ 2.5-inch PC Hard Drives offer the perfect storage solution for your gaming rig. WD Black 2.5-inch Hard Drives are purpose-built and tested to ensure they can handle the high-performance tasks you need. With up to 1TB of capacity, you get the space you need for your game's downloadable content, large cache sizes for fast load times, and 7200 RPM-Class drive for desktop-level performance.Industry Leading Warranty - WD Black™ 2.5-inch PC Hard Drives are tested under more strenuous conditions over a longer period when compared to our standard hard drives. This comprehensive testing ensures an overall quality benchmark for a stable, high performance storage solution backed by an industry leading 5-year limited warranty.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 11, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars I Love WD !
reviews.reviewText: I buy WD for almost all of my computer needs !

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 5, 2022
reviews.reviewText: I have been using & installing Western Digital drives for over 20 Years, Failure rate is very low, Their speed is good, When I have had to warranty them out it is simple compared to ither brands, The WD Black has been the best out of all WD drives except for their enterprise drives.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 12, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Disk is preformatted with a hidden partition
reviews.reviewText: Seller don't say of that disk is preformatted with a hidden partition to install Windows 10 (Lenovo)

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 21, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Good external drive for consoles.
reviews.reviewText: Works fine out of the "box" (its for a PS4 PRO (used as external drive). The only con is that it came barely protected when shipped so it could get damaged on transit. Other than that good drive for consoles.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 20, 2022
reviews.reviewText: Ordered two drives from the main listing (looked like Amazon, but was a third party) that took one week to arrive. Get the package opened, open one (Mfr. Date 23-May-2021). Click-click-click-click. Sure enough, DOA. That's fine, DOA drives happen, I go to check the S/N (WX22A215P8KC) on WD.com. Far from the "5 Year Warranty" advertised, WD says: "No Limited Warranty. Product was originally sold to a system manufacturer. Please contact the system manufacturer or the place of purchase for warranty service."At this point, I got in touch with Amazon to process a return because it's clear the third party sellers are reselling OEM goods and not actually new equipment. Double check the seller on your purchase!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 8, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Speed - This is a fast hard drive
reviews.reviewText: I bought this drive for my ~9 year old laptop which still is fast and reliable because I was concerned about the existing hard drive wearing out and having a problem. I decided to go with a mechanical hard drive rather than an SSD (Solid State Drive) because the mechanical hard drives last longer. I wanted as fast a drive as I could get which means that I wanted a 7200 RPM drive (RPM = spin rate and most hard drives are 5400) and a SATA 6 (data transfer rate). Amazon delivered the drive last night and this AM I swapped out my old hard drive and loaded my backup image that I made last night and everything worked out perfectly.I just found out that some Amazon products including this drive offer chat technical support (it appears to be free). On your order page which shows the order detail you will see a button to the right labelled GET HELP.If you are buying a new drive to replace your C drive which would be the case if your current C drive failed or if you need a larger capacity drive, you will need to have the ability to install Windows, the apps you installed on your current drive and your data on the new drive. Some PCs came with Windows recovery DVDs but most PCs require that you run a utility to create the recovery media. A couple of quick points;1) Create your disc image or recovery media on a USB rather than a DVD.2) Be sure to USB 3.0 flash drives rather than the slightly cheaper USB 2.0 flash drives. Disc images are large and the USB 3.0 standard is about 10 times faster than a USB 2.0. It would typically take about a minimum of 2 hours to create an image of a Win 10 system with your apps & files using a USB 3 flash drive or about 20 hours with a USB 2. USB 3, 3.1 and 3.2 are about the same speed.3) When creating your image, look at the options in the utility you are using and select any options that have the word 'legacy' support. If you have an older PC, you will need it and if you have a newer PC it won't hurt.4) Since my old drive was working, I used some free software from Macrium Software to create the image. At least I thought it was free and it was free to create the image but I must have missed some fine print that you have to buy a $70 license to restore the image made for free. I could have manually reinstalled all of the apps I had added (Thunderbird, Firefox, etc.) and my personal file backups and customize the system which would have taken 5 or 6 hours.Some of the terminology used by utilities that create disc backups is confusing. A clone is an exact disc to disc copy of the entire drive. To clone a drive, you need a 2nd hard drive (mechanical or SSD) installed in the PC or on the network. An image (vs a clone) is an exact copy of the entire disc written to another hard disc or a flash drive but not in a bootable format. An image copy is an intermediate format somewhat in the same sense that a ZIP file is an intermediate format.As an FYI, it is very easy to remove and replace a laptop from most if not all laptops made in the last 10 years or so. However, you will need a very small Philips head screw driver to physically make the change. Don't try using a larger screw drive and pushing hard as is you strip the slot you are screwed.As an FYI, the image of my Window 10 system with about 6g of personal files used 34g on my flash drive.12/12/2022 : Correction (possibly) - My comment about there being a charge to use Macrium Reflect to restore an image might be incorrect. There is an cost to "redeploy" an image but apparently not to "restore" an image. Redeploy is what would be required to restore an image to a different system or different hardware. I don't think that restoring an image to a different hard drive in the same system would be a redeploy so probably would be no charge. You could try doing the restore without paying a license charge and then only paying if required.

This is an excellent product. BUT, the Amazon warehouse tossed this is an envelope and was damaged in shipment.In the past, Amazon shipped disk drives in a cardboard box with nesting plastic inserts designed and made for the purpose, resulting in very safe shipmentI returned the defective item and await a replacement and hope it will be properly packaged
